de.systemagmbh.components.logger.checker
Class CSysCheckerByLevelCombination

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.components.logger.checker.ASysLogChecker
      de.systemagmbh.components.logger.checker.CSysCheckerByLevelCombination
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISysComponent, ISysDevelopmentLogSwitch, ISysGlobal, ISysLogChecker, ISysLogConstants
Deprecated. As of release 2.5, replaced by de.systemagmbh.tools.logger.checker.CSysCheckerByLevelCombination

public class CSysCheckerByLevelCombination
extends ASysLogChecker
implements ISysLogConstants

The class CSysCheckerByLevelCombination is used for checking loglevels, which are defined in the new configuration style setting levels as coma separated list of the following values:
FATAL, ERROR, WARNING, ALWAYS, COM, STEP, INFO, METHOD, ALL

Version:
$Revision: 1.13 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich, Torsten Knauft

checkLog

public boolean checkLog(String componentType,
                        int level,
                        Properties additionals)
Deprecated. 
This method defines the way, how a logger will format the log output.

Specified by:
checkLog in interface ISysLogChecker
Parameters:
componentType - The name of the application part that called the log method.
This is used for the component log levels!
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not need this information.)
level - The level that is used for logging the given text.
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not need this information.)
additionals - Additional Properties. These parameters may be checked also.
Returns:
true if the check was positive. That is the log entry has to be logged.
